result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark M. Hartwick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If the defendant's probation is revoked, he is eligible for programming.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to prison sentences in 21CF284 and 22CF28.
If the defendant's probation is revoked, the conditions of extended supervision shall be the same as the conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  Court costs are paid in full.
-------------------

Defendant must enter into and successfully complete the Walworth County Drug Court Program, and comply with all rules, recommendations, requirements, and fees of the program.
-------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

Defendant in court with attorney Mackenzie Renner. ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is on for motion for modification of bond. Bond had previously been addressed. Bond matter is moot at this point. Sentencing already set; no victims in the case.  Update court with new phone number 262-745-3408. Cou0rt in recess at 839 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

8:36 AM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark M. Hartwick in court, in custody.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Mark M. Hartwick. 
State will be asking for a PSI. 
Motion to suppress on 21CF284 is withdrawn. 
Atty Renner will be asking the court to not order the PSI. 
21CF284- Deft enters guilty plea to count 1, count 2 and count 3. 
21CF677- Deft enters guilty plea 
22CF23- Deft enters guilty plea to count 1, count 2, and count 3. 
22CF28- Deft enters guilty plea to count 1, count 2 and count 3. 
22CF63- Deft enters guilty plea. 
22CF108- Deft enters guilty plea. 
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. 
Plea is freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently made. 
Court gives warning to deportation. 
Court orders PSI. 
Sentencing to be set out 60 days. 
Bond remains.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Defendant Mark M. Hartwick appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Mark M. Hartwick.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 11:02 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for scheduling of Motion to Suppress on all files - 22CF23, 22CF28, 21CF677, 21CF284, 22CF63, 22CF108, and 21CF284. Record by the Court as to request of Atty. Renner to adjourn the matter. State does not object. Court goes off the record for scheduling. All matters will be reassigned and scheduled before the assigned judge.

$7,500.00 ALREADY POSTED, MUST POST AN ADDITIONAL $2,500.00
BOND TOTAL ALL FILES - 22CF28, 22CF108, 22CF63, 22CF23, 21CF677, 21CF284.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH J.M.K. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Mark M. Hartwick in court.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Mark M. Hartwick. Court in session @ 9:36 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court on all files for arraignment on all files - 21CF284, 21CF677, 22CF23, 22CF28, 22CF63, 22CF108, and to address treatment. Record by Atty. Kim that he has reviewed the charges and penalties and enters not guilty pleas on all files. 
9:38 a.m. - Court addresses treatment issue. Response by Atty. Kim. Record by Mr. Hartwick as to Rogers Memorial and evaluation, he is accepted but will not have a bed until sometime this week. Mr. Hartwick responds to further questions of the Court as to prior treatment program that the defendant was to enter. 
9:39 a.m. - Response by the State who asks that prior cash bond be reinstated in the amount of $10,000.00. Further record by the State as to other issues in Village of Williams Bay for contact with Williams Bay Health property. Atty. Herrmann responds to further questions of the Court. 
9:41 a.m. - Response by Atty. Kim. Further record by Atty. Herrmann.
9:43 a.m. - Record by the Court as to Mount Zion House approval that defendant did not report. Further record as to Salvation Army program that defendant failed to enroll in. Response/record by Atty. Kim as to Mount Zion. Response by the Court who does not believe that Mr. Hartwick is not willing to enter treatment at this time and reinstates cash bond at this time.
Motion hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Mark M. Hartwick appeared in court, Attorney Tony Kim for Mark M. Hartwick appeared in court, Attorney Andrew Herrmann for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Called @ 3:26 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for arraignment on 21CF677, 22CF23, 22CF28, 22CF63, and 22CF108. Record by the Court as to clerical order regarding motion to suppress hearing that needs to be reset. Response/record by Atty. Kim who asks that motion not be set at this time. Further record as to defendant's acceptance into in patient treatment at Salvation Army program. They will take him, but had to wait until today's hearing was completed as defendant may not leave facility for any reason for 30 days. Atty. has letter from Salvation Army and responds to further questions of the Court. Atty. Kim addresses defendant's bond indicating that defendant was to report to Mount Zion - who referred the defendant to the Salvation Army program as it was a better fit. Court addresses defendant's father as to status of defendant. Court sets all matters over for a couple of weeks for arraignments. If defendant is in treatment, Court will waive his appearance for that hearing. Court in recess.
Arraignment scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant in court in custody via video with atty Uzowulu. ADA  for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has been advised of his rights to preliminary hearing is waiving. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Motion to modify bond filed. State objects to motion to modify bond. Victim present in court and makes statement. Court has reviewed bond modification. Must report to Zion House immediately and report filed with court has completed intake process. Bond reduced $7500 cash same prior conditions w/ additional conditions, No violent contact w/ J.M.K. Updates of weekly reports from treatment to center. Must remain in program until successful completion. State asks for an arraignment date set over, 3-15 at 3pm.
